name: Circus 1 Quiz / Test | Circuses & Fairs | 10 Questions

questions.text: John Wayne appeared in which of the following circus movies?
questions.explanation:
Circus World.

	This was a 1964 movie made in Spain. It co-starred Claudia Cardinale, Rita Hayworth and Lloyd Nolan.

questions.text: In what year was Clown College found?
questions.explanation:
1968.

	It was founded in Sarasota, Florida by theatrical promoter, Irvin Feld. It is open from July to September and as of 1999 has graduated more than 1200 students.The official name is Ringling Brothers and Barnum and Bailey Clown College.

questions.text: Which of the following were NOT part of earlier circuses?
questions.explanation:
Flying Trapeze.

	Although aerobatic acts were part of the circus the flying trapeze did not come about until 1859.

questions.text: What President reportedly attended a Rickett's Circus and sold the company a horse?
questions.explanation:
Washington.

	According to reports this took place in 1797.

questions.text: In which city was the first circus in the United States?
questions.explanation:
Philadelphia.

	In 1792, it was introduced by John Bill Ricketts an English equestrian.

questions.text: Larry Harmon introduced what clown in the early 1950s?
questions.explanation:
Bozo.

	Buttons was the clown in 'The Greatest Show On Earth' and Clarabell was the clown on the 'Howdy Doody Show'.

questions.text: Where does the word 'circus' come from?
questions.explanation:
Latin.

	It is from the Latin word for circle or ring.

questions.text: Where was the first modern circus staged?
questions.explanation:
London.

	In 1768 by Philip Astley who performed as a trick rider.

questions.text: When are circus tents believed to have come into use?
questions.explanation:
1700s.

	One ring circus tents first appeared in France in the 1790s.

questions.text: Who played 'Buttons' the clown in the Oscar winning movie 'The Greatest Show On Earth'?
questions.explanation:
Jimmy Stewart.

	Buttons was a murderer disguised as a clown traveling with the circus to avoid being arrested.
